revised_title: The Impact of Corynebacterium parvum on Tumor Growth in T-cell Deprived Mice
tldr: The authors studied the growth of tumors in T-cell deprived mice and their response to treatment with Corynebacterium parvum. They found that the depletion of thymus-derived lymphocytes did not reduce, and may have even increased, the resistance of mice to syngeneic tumors. The injection of killed C. parvum caused further inhibition of tumor growth in T-cell deprived mice, supporting the hypothesis that the antitumor effect of C. parvum depends primarily on macrophage stimulation.
